get.summary: Adds a message to the chat log.
get.description: Adds a message to the chat log.

parameters.name: message
parameters.description: The chat message.

get.summary: Changes the password of an existing user on the server.
get.description: Changes the password of an existing user on the server, using the following parameters. You can only change your own password unless you have admin privileges.

parameters.name: username
parameters.description: The name of the user which should change its password.

parameters.name: password
parameters.description: The new password of the new user, either in clear text of hex-encoded (see above).

get.description: Creates or updates a bookmark (a position within a media file). Bookmarks are personal and not visible to other users.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the media file to bookmark. If a bookmark already exists for this file it will be overwritten.

parameters.name: position
parameters.description: The position (in milliseconds) within the media file.

parameters.name: comment
parameters.description: A user-defined comment.

get.summary: Adds a new internet radio station.
get.description: Adds a new internet radio station. Only users with admin privileges are allowed to call this method.

parameters.name: streamUrl
parameters.description: The stream URL for the station.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The station name.

parameters.name: homepageUrl
parameters.description: The home page URL for the station.

get.description: Creates (or updates) a playlist.

parameters.name: playlistId
parameters.description: The playlist ID. Required if updating an existing playlist.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The human-readable name of the playlist. Required if creating a new playlist.

parameters.name: songId
parameters.description: ID of a song in the playlist. Use one `songId` parameter for each song in the playlist.

get.description: Adds a new Podcast channel. Note: The user must be authorized for Podcast administration (see Settings > Users > User is allowed to administrate Podcasts).

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: The URL of the Podcast to add.

get.summary: Creates a public URL that can be used by anyone to stream music or video from the server.
get.description: Creates a public URL that can be used by anyone to stream music or video from the server. The URL is short and suitable for posting on Facebook, Twitter etc. Note: The user must be authorized to share (see Settings > Users > User is allowed to share files with anyone). Since 1.6.0.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of a song, album or video to share. Use one id parameter for each entry to share.

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: A user-defined description that will be displayed to people visiting the shared media.

parameters.name: expires
parameters.description: The time at which the share expires. Given as milliseconds since 1970.

get.summary: Creates a new user on the server.
get.description: Creates a new user on the server.

parameters.name: username
parameters.description: The name of the new user.

parameters.name: password
parameters.description: The password of the new user, either in clear text of hex-encoded (see above).

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: The email address of the new user.

parameters.name: ldapAuthenticated
parameters.description: Whether the user is authenticated in LDAP.

parameters.name: adminRole
parameters.description: Whether the user is administrator.

parameters.name: settingsRole
parameters.description: Whether the user is allowed to change personal settings and password.

parameters.name: streamRole
parameters.description: Whether the user is allowed to play files.

parameters.name: jukeboxRole
parameters.description: Whether the user is allowed to play files in jukebox mode.

parameters.name: downloadRole
parameters.description: Whether the user is allowed to download files.

parameters.name: uploadRole
parameters.description: Whether the user is allowed to upload files.

parameters.name: playlistRole
parameters.description: Whether the user is allowed to create and delete playlists. Since 1.8.0, changing this role has no effect.

parameters.name: coverArtRole
parameters.description: Whether the user is allowed to change cover art and tags.

parameters.name: commentRole
parameters.description: Whether the user is allowed to create and edit comments and ratings.

parameters.name: podcastRole
parameters.description: Whether the user is allowed to administrate Podcasts.

parameters.name: shareRole
parameters.description: (Since 1.8.0) Whether the user is allowed to share files with anyone.

parameters.name: videoConversionRole
parameters.description: (Since 1.15.0) Whether the user is allowed to start video conversions.

parameters.name: musicFolderId
parameters.description: (Since 1.12.0) IDs of the music folders the user is allowed access to. Include the parameter once for each folder. Default all folders.

get.description: Deletes a bookmark (a position within a media file). Bookmarks are personal and not visible to other users.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the media file for which to delete the bookmark. Other users’ bookmarks are not affected.

get.summary: Deletes an existing internet radio station.
get.description: Deletes an existing internet radio station. Only users with admin privileges are allowed to call this method.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID for the station.

get.description: Deletes a saved playlist.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the playlist to delete, as obtained by `getPlaylists`.

get.description: Deletes a Podcast channel. Note: The user must be authorized for Podcast administration (see Settings > Users > User is allowed to administrate Podcasts).

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the Podcast channel to delete.

get.description: Deletes a Podcast episode. Note: The user must be authorized for Podcast administration (see Settings > Users > User is allowed to administrate Podcasts).

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the Podcast episode to delete.

get.description: Deletes an existing share

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the share to delete.

get.summary: Deletes an existing user on the server.
get.description: Deletes an existing user on the server.

parameters.name: username
parameters.description: The name of the user to delete.

get.description: Downloads a given media file. Similar to stream, but this method returns the original media data without transcoding or downsampling.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A string which uniquely identifies the file to stream. Obtained by calls to getMusicDirectory.

get.summary: Request the server to start downloading a given Podcast episode.
get.description: Request the server to start downloading a given Podcast episode. Note: The user must be authorized for Podcast administration (see Settings > Users > User is allowed to administrate Podcasts).

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the Podcast episode to download

get.description: Returns details for an album, including a list of songs. This method organizes music according to ID3 tags.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The album ID.

get.description: Returns album notes, image URLs etc, using data from last.fm.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The album ID or song ID.

get.description: Similar to getAlbumInfo, but organizes music according to ID3 tags.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The album ID or song ID.

get.summary: Returns a list of random, newest, highest rated etc. albums.
get.description: Returns a list of random, newest, highest rated etc. albums. Similar to the album lists on the home page of the Subsonic web interface.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: The number of albums to return. Max 500.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The list offset. Useful if you for example want to page through the list of newest albums.

parameters.name: fromYear
parameters.description: Required if `type=='byYear'`. The first year in the range. If `fromYear` > `toYear` a reverse chronological list is returned.

parameters.name: toYear
parameters.description: Required if `type=='byYear'`. The last year in the range.

parameters.name: genre
parameters.description: Required if `type=='byGenre'`. The name of the genre, e.g., Rock.

parameters.name: musicFolderId
parameters.description: (Since 1.11.0) Only return albums in the music folder with the given ID. See `getMusicFolders`.

get.summary: Returns a list of random, newest, highest rated etc. albums (v2).
get.description: Similar to `getAlbumList`, but organizes music according to ID3 tags.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: The number of albums to return. Max 500.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The list offset. Useful if you for example want to page through the list of newest albums.

parameters.name: fromYear
parameters.description: Required if `type=='byYear'`. The first year in the range. If `fromYear` > `toYear` a reverse chronological list is returned.

parameters.name: toYear
parameters.description: Required if `type=='byYear'`. The last year in the range.

parameters.name: genre
parameters.description: Required if `type=='byGenre'`. The name of the genre, e.g., Rock.

parameters.name: musicFolderId
parameters.description: (Since 1.11.0) Only return albums in the music folder with the given ID. See `getMusicFolders`.

get.description: Returns details for an artist, including a list of albums. This method organizes music according to ID3 tags.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The artist ID.

get.description: Returns artist info with biography, image URLs and similar artists, using data from last.fm.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The artist, album or song ID.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: Max number of similar artists to return.

parameters.name: includeNotPresent
parameters.description: Whether to return artists that are not present in the media library.

get.description: Similar to `getArtistInfo`, but organizes music according to ID3 tags.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The artist, album or song ID.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: Max number of similar artists to return.

parameters.name: includeNotPresent
parameters.description: Whether to return artists that are not present in the media library.

get.description: Similar to `getIndexes`, but organizes music according to ID3 tags.

parameters.name: musicFolderId
parameters.description: If specified, only return artists in the music folder with the given ID. See `getMusicFolders`.

get.summary: Returns the avatar (personal image) for a user.
get.description: Returns the avatar (personal image) for a user.

get.summary: Returns all bookmarks for this user.
get.description: Returns all bookmarks for this user. A bookmark is a position within a certain media file.

schema.description: Error response TODO: TO BE DESCRIBED

v.name: v
v.description: The protocol version implemented by the client, i.e., the version of the subsonic-rest-api.xsd schema used (see below).

f.name: f
f.description: The response format. Must be 'xml' or 'json'. For the purposes of this document, only 'json' is described.

c.name: c
c.description: A unique string identifying the client application.

t.name: t
t.description: (Since 1.13.0) The authentication token computed as md5(password + salt). `u` and `s` must be specified. See https://opensubsonic.netlify.app/docs/api-reference/#authentication for details.

s.name: s
s.description: (Since 1.13.0) A random string (salt) used as input for computing the password hash. `u` and `t` must be specified. See https://opensubsonic.netlify.app/docs/api-reference/#authentication for details.

apiKey.name: apiKey
apiKey.description: [OS] An API key used for authentication. If specified, `p`, `t`, `s` nor `u` can be specified.

p.name: p
p.description: The password, either in clear text or hex-encoded with a enc: prefix. Since 1.13.0 this should only be used for testing purposes. `u` must be specified.

code.description:
The error code.
* 0: A generic error.
* 10: Required parameter is missing.
* 20: Incompatible Subsonic REST protocol version. Client must upgrade.
* 30: Incompatible Subsonic REST protocol version. Server must upgrade.
* 40: Wrong username or password.
* 41: Token authentication not supported for LDAP users.
* 42: Provided authentication mechanism not supported.
* 43: Multiple conflicting authentication mechanisms provided.
* 44: Invalid API key.
* 50: User is not authorized for the given operation.
* 60: The trial period for the Subsonic server is over. Please upgrade to Subsonic Premium. Visit subsonic.org for details.
* 70: The requested data was not found.

helpUrl.description: A URL (documentation, configuration, etc) which may provide additional context for the error)

example.message: Authentication mechanism not supported. Use API keys

version.description: The server supported Subsonic API version.

type.description: The server actual name. [Ex: Navidrome or gonic]

openSubsonic.description: Must return true if the server support OpenSubsonic API v1

status.description: The status of the request. [Ex: success]
The status of the request. [Ex: failed]

ItemGenre.description: A genre returned in list of genres for an item.

artistImageUrl.description: An url to an external image source.

roles.description: The list of all roles this artist has in the library.

Contributor.description: A contributor artist for a song or an album

subRole.description: The subRole for roles that may require it. Ex: The instrument for the performer role (TMCL/performer tags). Note: For consistency between different tag formats, the TIPL sub roles should be directly exposed in the role field.

ReplayGain.description: The replay gain data of a song. Note: If the data is not present the field must be ommited in the answer. (But the replayGain field on Child must always be present)

trackGain.description: The track replay gain value. (In Db)

albumGain.description: The album replay gain value. (In Db)

trackPeak.description: The track peak value. (Must be positive)

albumPeak.description: The album peak value. (Must be positive)

baseGain.description: The base gain value. (In Db) (Ogg Opus Output Gain for example)

fallbackGain.description: An optional fallback gain that clients should apply when the corresponding gain value is missing. (Can be computed from the tracks or exposed as an user setting.)

MediaType.description: Note: If you support `musicBrainzId` you must support this field to ensure clients knows what the ID refers to.

ExplicitStatus.description: Returns explicit, clean or . (For songs extracted from tags ITUNESADVISORY: 1 = explicit, 2 = clean, MP4 rtng: 1 or 4 = explicit, 2 = clean. See `albumID3` for albums)

size.description: A file size of the media.

suffix.description: The file suffix of the media.

transcodedContentType.description: The transcoded mediaType if transcoding should happen.

transcodedSuffix.description: The file suffix of the transcoded media.

duration.description: The duration of the media in seconds.

bitDepth.description: The bit depth of the media.

samplingRate.description: The sampling rate of the media.

channelCount.description: The number of channels of the media.

path.description: The full path of the media.

userRating.description: The user rating of the media [1-5]

averageRating.description: The average rating of the media [1.0-5.0]

played.description: Date the album was last played. [ISO 8601]

comment.description: The comment tag of the song.

genres.description: The list of all genres of the song.

artists.description: The list of all song artists of the song. (Note: Only the required `ArtistID3` fields should be returned by default)

albumArtists.description: The list of all album artists of the song. (Note: Only the required `ArtistID3` fields should be returned by default)

displayAlbumArtist.description: The single value display album artist.

contributors.description: The list of all contributor artists of the song.

moods.description: The list of all moods of the song.

replayGain.description: The replay gain data of the song.

allOf.description: A subsonic-response element with a nested shares element on success. Which in turns contains a single share element for the newly created share

RecordLabel.description: A record label for an album.

ItemDate.description: A date for a media item that may be just a year, or year-month, or full date.

DiscTitle.description: A disc title for an album

version.description: The album version name (Remastered, Anniversary Box Set, ).

duration.description: Total duration of the album in seconds

playCount.description: Number of play of the album

played.description: Date the album was last played. [ISO 8601]

userRating.description: The user rating of the album. [1-5]

genres.description: The list of all genres of the album.

artists.description: The list of all album artists of the album.

releaseTypes.description: The types of this album release. (Album, Compilation, EP, Remix, ).

moods.description: The list of all moods of the album.

originalReleaseDate.description: Date the album was originally released.

releaseDate.description: Date the specific edition of the album was released. Note: for files using ID3 tags, releaseDate should generally be read from the TDRL tag. Servers that use a different source for this field should document the behavior.

isCompilation.description: True if the album is a compilation.

discTitles.description: The list of all disc titles of the album.

allOf.description: A subsonic-response element with a nested album element on success.
A subsonic-response element with a nested albumInfo element on success.

AlbumListType.description: The list type. Must be one of the following: random, newest, highest, frequent, recent. Since 1.8.0 you can also use alphabeticalByName or alphabeticalByArtist to page through all albums alphabetically, and starred to retrieve starred albums. Since 1.10.1 you can use byYear and byGenre to list albums in a given year range or genre.

allOf.description: A subsonic-response element with a nested albumList element on success.
A subsonic-response element with a nested albumList2 element on success.
A subsonic-response element with a nested `artist` element on success.
A subsonic-response element with a nested `artistInfo` element on success.
A subsonic-response element with a nested `artistInfo2` element on success.

ignoredArticles.description: List of ignored articles space separated

allOf.description: A subsonic-response element with a nested `artists` element on success.
A subsonic-response element with a nested `bookmarks` element on success.
